NFTCollection.name: NFTCollection
NFTCollection.summary: Create a collection of one-of-one NFTs.
NFTCollection.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_nft_collection("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the token balance of a specific address

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens in the contract

methods.name: get_owned
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens owned by a specific address

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint a batch of new NFTs to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# You can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas = [
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cooler NFT",
        "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
]

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
txs = contract.mint_batch_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadatas)
receipt = txs[0].receipt
first_token_id = txs[0].id
first_nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint a new NFT to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadata = NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
    "name": "Cool NFT",
    "description": "This is a cool NFT",
    "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
})

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata)
receipt = tx.receipt
token_id = tx.id
nft = tx.data()

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.

Edition.name: Edition
Edition.summary: Create a collection of NFTs that lets you mint multiple copies of each NFT.
Edition.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_edition("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get a specific wallets balance of a specific token

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata for all tokens on the contract

methods.name: get_owned
methods.summary: Get the metadata for all the tokens owned by an address

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint a batch of NFTs to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas_with_supply = [
    EditionMetadataInput(
        NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
            "name": "Cool NFT",
            "description": "This is a cool NFT",
            "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
        }),
        100
    ),
    EditionMetadataInput(
        NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
            "name": "Cooler NFT",
            "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
            "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
        }),
        100
    )
]

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
txs = contract.mint_batch_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadatas_with_supply)
receipt = txs[0].receipt
token_id = txs[0].id
nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint a new NFT to the specified wallet
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput, EditionMetadataInput

# Note that you can customize this metadata however you like
metadata_with_supply = EditionMetadataInput(
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    100
)

# You can pass in any address here to mint the NFT to
tx = contract.mint_to("{{wallet_address}}", metadata_with_supply)
receipt = tx.receipt
token_id = tx.id
nft = tx.data()

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.
methods.example:
to = "{{wallet_address}}"
token_id = 0
amount = 1

receipt = contract.transfer(to, token_id, amount)

Token.name: Token
Token.summary: Create a standard crypto token or cryptocurrency.
Token.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_token("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: allowance
methods.summary: Get a specific spenders allowance of this token for the connected wallet.

methods.name: allowance_of
methods.summary: Get the allowance of the specified spender for a specified owner.
methods.example:
# Address of the wallet who owns the funds
address = "{{wallet_address}}"

# Address of the wallet to check the token allowance
spender = "0x..."

allowance = contract.allowance_of(address, spender)
print(allowance)

methods.name: balance
methods.summary: Get the token balance of the connected wallet.

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the balance of the specified wallet

methods.name: burn
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of tokens from the connected wallet.

methods.name: burn_from
methods.summary: Burn a specified amount of tokens from a specified wallet.

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get the token metadata including name, symbol, decimals, etc.

methods.name: mint_batch_to
methods.summary: Mint tokens to a list of wallets.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.currency import TokenAmount

args = [
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 1),
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 2),
]

contract.mint_batch_to(args)

methods.name: mint_to
methods.summary: Mint tokens to a specified wallet.

methods.name: set_allowance
methods.summary: Sets the allowance of the specified wallet over the connected wallets funds to        a specified amount.

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified amount of tokens from the connected wallet to a specified address.
methods.example:
# Address to send tokens to
to = "0x...

# Amount of tokens to transfer
amount = 0.1

contract.transfer(to, amount)

methods.name: transfer_batch
methods.summary: Transfer tokens from the connected wallet to many wallets.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.currency import TokenAmount

data = [
    TokenAmount("{{wallet_address}}", 0.1),
    TokenAmount("0x...", 0.2),
]

contract.transfer_batch(data)

methods.name: transfer_from
methods.summary: Transfer a specified amount of tokens from one specified address to another.
methods.example:
# Address to send tokens from
fr = "{{wallet_address}}"

# Address to send tokens to
to = "0x..."

# Amount of tokens to transfer
amount = 0.1

contract.transfer_from(fr, to, amount)

Marketplace.name: Marketplace
Marketplace.summary: Create your own whitelabel marketplace that enables users to buy and sell any digital assets.
Marketplace.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_marketplace("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: buyout_listing
methods.summary: Buyout a listing by listing ID

methods.name: get_active_listings
methods.summary: Get all the currently active listings from the marketplace.

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get all the listings that have ever been made on this marketplace.

methods.name: get_all_listings
methods.summary: Get all the listings that have ever been made on this marketplace.

methods.name: set_bid_buffer_bps
methods.summary: Set the bid buffer basis points for this marketplace.

methods.name: set_time_buffer_in_seconds
methods.summary: Set the time buffer of the marketplace.

NFTDrop.name: NFTDrop
NFTDrop.summary: Setup a collection of one-of-one NFTs that are minted as users claim them.
NFTDrop.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_nft_drop("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the token balance of a specific address

methods.name: claim_to
methods.summary: Claim NFTs to a destination address.
methods.example:
address = {{wallet_address}}
quantity = 1

tx = contract.claim_to(address, quantity)
receipt = tx.receipt
claimed_token_id = tx.id
claimed_nft = tx.data()

methods.name: create_batch
methods.summary: Create a batch of NFTs.
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types.nft import NFTMetadataInput

# You can customize this metadata however you like
metadatas = [
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cool NFT",
        "description": "This is a cool NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
    NFTMetadataInput.from_json({
        "name": "Cooler NFT",
        "description": "This is a cooler NFT",
        "image": open("path/to/file.jpg", "rb"),
    }),
]

txs = contract.create_batch(metadatas)
first_token_id = txs[0].id
first_nft = txs[0].data()

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens in the contract

methods.summary: Get all claimed NFTs.

methods.summary: Get all unclaimed NFTs.

methods.name: total_claimed_supply

methods.name: total_unclaimed_supply
methods.summary: Get the total number of unclaimed NFTs in this contract

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.

Multiwrap.name: Multiwrap
Multiwrap.summary: Multiwrap lets you wrap any number of ERC20, ERC721, or ERC1155 tokens into    a single wrapped token bundle.
Multiwrap.example:
from thirdweb import ThirdwebSDK

# You can customize this to a supported network or your own RPC URL
network = "mumbai"

# Now we can create a new instance of the SDK
sdk = ThirdwebSDK(network)

# If you want to send transactions, you can instantiate the SDK with a private key instead:
#   sdk = ThirdwebSDK.from_private_key(PRIVATE_KEY, network)

contract = sdk.get_multiwrap("{{contract_address}}")

methods.name: balance_of
methods.summary: Get the token balance of a specific address

methods.name: get
methods.summary: Get metadata for a token

methods.name: get_all
methods.summary: Get the metadata of all tokens in the contract

methods.name: get_wrapped_contents
methods.summary: Get the contents of a wrapped token bundle
methods.example:
token_id = 0
contents = contract.get_wrapped_contents(token_id)
print(contents.erc20_tokens)
print(contents.erc721_tokens)
print(contents.erc1155_tokens)

methods.name: transfer
methods.summary: Transfer a specified token from the connected wallet to a specified address.

methods.name: unwrap
methods.summary: Unwrap a wrapped token bundle

methods.name: wrap
methods.summary: Wrap any number of ERC20, ERC721, or ERC1155 tokens into a single wrapped token
methods.example:
from thirdweb.types import (
    TokensToWrap,
    ERC20Wrappable,
    ERC721Wrappable,
    ERC1155Wrappable,
    NFTMetadataInput,
)

# Contract setup goes here...

tx = contract.wrap(
    TokensToWrap(
        erc20_tokens=[
            ERC20Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", quantity=0.8),
        ],
        erc721_tokens=[
            ERC721Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", token_id=0),
        ],
        erc1155_tokens=[
            ERC1155Wrappable(contract_address="0x...", token_id=0, quantity=1),
        ]
    ),
    NFTMetadataInput(
        name="Wrapped NFT",
        description="This is a wrapped bundle of tokens and NFTs",
        image="ipfs://...",
    )
)

print(tx.receipt, tx.id)

WalletAuthenticator.name: WalletAuthenticator
WalletAuthenticator.summary: > This API is provided as a preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.    >
WalletAuthenticator.example:
# We specify the domain of the application to authenticate to
domain = "thirdweb.com"

# We can then generate a payload for the connected wallet to login
# This can also be done on the client side with the thirdweb TypeScript SDK
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Then, on the server, we can securely verify the connected address that signed the payload
address = sdk.auth.verify(domain, payload)

# And we can also generate an authentication token to send back to the original payload sender
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)

# Finally, the token can be use dby the original payload sender to authenticate to the backend
# And the server can use the following function to authenticate the token and verify the address
address = sdk.auth.authenticate(domain, token)

methods.name: authenticate
methods.summary: Server-side function that authenticates the provided JWT token. This function verifies that        the provided authentication token is valid and returns the address of the authenticated wallet.
methods.example:
domain = "thirdweb.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)

# Authenticate the token and get the address of the authenticating wallet
address = sdk.auth.authenticate(domain, token)

methods.name: generate_auth_token
methods.summary: Server-side function that generates a JWT token from the provided login request that the        client-side wallet can use to authenticate to the server-side application.
methods.example:
domain = "thirdweb.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Generate an authentication token for the logged in wallet
token = sdk.auth.generate_auth_token(domain, payload)

methods.name: login
methods.summary: Client-side function that allows the connected wallet to login to a server-side application.        Generates a login payload that can be sent to the server-side for verification or authentication.
methods.example:
# Add the domain of the application that you want to log in to
domain = "thirdweb.com"

# Generate a signed login payload for the connected wallet to authenticate with
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

methods.name: verify
methods.summary: Server-side function to securely verify the address of the logged in client-side wallet        by validating the provided client-side login request.
methods.example:
domain = "thirdweb.com"
payload = sdk.auth.login(domain)

# Verify the login request
address = sdk.auth.verify(domain, payload)
